data.title: Fix UpgradeActorsNear revoking upgrades after the actor dies
data.body:
Very hard bug to reproduce: if you can power down a stealth generator just as it is dieing you can hit a race condition that leads to ActorExited() being called to revoke the upgrades after they have already been revoked once.

It helps if you have 100000 actors so the performance is bad enough for the race condition to be more likely to happen. If people want I can upload a couple of replays where I eventually managed to reproduce the crash.

Related to #9242 - exception is the same, with just the source being `UpgradeActorsNear` instead of `DeployToUpgrade`.

data.title: Crash in multiplayer lobby/global chat using game filter
data.body:
(Playtest 20151114) Win 8.1
To recreate click/go:
- Multiplayer
- Connect to global IRC
- select (single click) one of the servers (so that you can see the map preview)
- open filter and deselect and reselect the "empty" filter
  (crash)

Ther might be other ways to replicate this, but this is easy enough. I tested nad crashed 4 times in a row.

exception.log
http://www.megafileupload.com/i4mo/exception.log
- If for some reason you don't crash select another server and do a bit of filter switching. "Works" for me :)

Currently on bleed, prep-1512 (playtest-20151114) and release-20150919.

data.title: Mute setting
data.body:
For those of us who like to both test and play the game. Adds a mute checkbox in Audio -> Settings. Also displays a small string in the lobby music widget if enabled.

As always criticisms welcome; Esp feedback on layout / labeling.

data.title: Fix some comment typos
AA-gun keeps shooting at units that are out of its vision, but in its range
data.body:
1. Run 2 clients
2. Place an AA-gun (client 1)
3. Build a Mig and try to direct it into the AA-gun (client 2)
4. Once you're in its eyesight, try to evade it (hide behind the shroud again)
5. Evidence your Mig dying, because AA-gun was shooting into the shroud.

data.title: Husks aren't targetable on refinery pads
data.body:
Caused by husks having no `Selectable:` `Priority:`. If an actor isn't selectable, it'll default to having the lowest selection priority possible.

Unit targeting code checks for all actors under cursor, and picks the actor with highest priority: [UnitOrderGenerator.cs:L24](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/blob/206f64494965c08d89db618cdea2f519c355b091/OpenRA.Game/Orders/UnitOrderGenerator.cs#L24)

data.title: Implement player authentication via hidden global chat messages.
data.body:
This is a specific proposal for how to implement #2265 / #4410 using identified IRC nicknames and a call/response via PRIVMSG.
1.  Enable identification / name enforcement on the IRC server backend (ping @baxxxster).
2.  The server sends a random blob to the client as part of the `HandshakeRequest` and stores it as part of the server-side client data (which is stripped out before sending to other clients).
3.  The client generates a random blowfish (or substitute a different algorithm if we want more security) key, stores it for future use in the `GlobalChat` class, and then encrypts the blob using this key and our existing `Blowfish` code.
4.  The client returns the encrypted blob and their authenticated IRC nickname as part of the `HandshakeResponse` (or empty data if they do not want to authenticate).  New keys are generated for each handshake, so there is no problem with this data being saved in replays.
5.  The client joins the server as normal and the server assigns a status of AUTHENTICATING if they returned an auth response, or UNAUTHENTICATED if they did not (stored as another field on Client, which is shared with all clients).
6.  The server, which has its own connection to the global IRC network (but doesn't join any channels) sends a PRIVMSG containing the encrypted data to the nickname returned in the handshake.
7.  The client, which is of course already logged into IRC, receives the PRIVMSG, decrypts it using the stored key, and then responds via PRIVMSG.  The IRC nick enforcement means that a malicious player that puts somebody elses IRC name in the handshake response cannot receive this message.
8.  The server checks that that the response matches the original blob sent in the handshake request.  If it matches then the server is confident that the client is who they say they are and sets their status to AUTHENTICATED.  If it does not agree, or if it does not recieve a response within an appropriate timeout, then it sets their status to UNAUTHENTICATED.

The lobby UI then uses the authentication status shared by the server to show an appropriate icon in the ping/admin block.  Player names are _not_ required to match the IRC nickname, but the IRC nickname _will_ be shown in the ping/admin block tooltip.

Clients who connect via a regular IRC client would be able to see these background messages and send data to the servers.  This is not a problem because those messages don't contain any sensitive information, and the server would ignore any responses that it doesn't expect or understand.  The server IRC connection can also be used for server management (cc @cjshmyr, who is implementing this for #6538).

A similar process can be used for authenticating servers against a central player stats database, but that is significantly out of scope of this initial implementation.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/28248137-implement-player-authentication-via-hidden-global-chat-messages?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Remap errors for MPSPAWN, CAMERA and WAYPOINT
data.body: They were supposed to be semi-transparent and remapped to player colors. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/3377#issuecomment-76590891

data.title: Fix CellRegion.BoundingRegion behaviour.
data.body: CellRegions use MPos internally, and so the bounding area must be calculated in these coordinates in order for it to behave properly in the isometric mods.  This fixes the wonky copy/paste selection area in the TS map editor.

data.title: Check deploy location at the time of transform.
data.body:
A simpler version of #9918.

Fixes #6683.
Fixes #9902.

Best viewed ignoring whitespace: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9987/files?w=1

data.title: Map editor tooltip margins are incorrect
data.body:
The margins of the tooltip type introduced by #9925 have at least three problem cases:
1. The top/bottom margins are wrong for all mods.
2. The margin between lines are wrong for all mods.
3. Leading / trailing newlines are not stripped, allowing empty rows.

![screen shot 2015-11-11 at 23 11 08](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/11105835/957d186e-88c9-11e5-8385-9ebae6c9cb8b.png)
![screen shot 2015-11-11 at 23 10 43](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/11105839/974c0830-88c9-11e5-8dc1-5c2150ababf8.png)
![screen shot 2015-11-11 at 23 14 36](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/11105945/31f7fb1e-88ca-11e5-9557-63bf221dcb1d.png)
![screen shot 2015-11-11 at 23 13 25](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/11105951/3981ba1e-88ca-11e5-8602-e9fbadbaf66b.png)

data.body: Small bit of polish

data.title: Lower Spy's InfiltrateForPowerOutage time from 30->20sec
data.body: As 30 seconds is quite punishing right now

data.title: Externally capturing a building cancels its production
data.body: Unintentionally introduced with #6766, which still can be reproduced (#8146) regardless. When externally capturing a building, its entire production queue is cleared out and made unavailable until the capture is either completed or halted.

data.title: Unhardcode and document things in Chronoshiftable
Added gates to Tiberian Sun
data.body:
- Reuses some code from #7888
- Closes #3196
###### Works by
- Letting the pathfinder think there is no obstruction (for friendly and open gates)
- Blocking movement for closed gates and opens via OnNotifyBlockingMove
###### Improvements for the future:
- [fix zoffset for gates](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9981#issuecomment-174310942)
- placing gates on existing walls
- [fix the hitbox](https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9981#issuecomment-170360964)
